LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_ElderScrollsQuadrums: Switch quadrum names to something more flavourful.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_ElderScrollsQuadrumsToolt: This may not take affect immediately if switched mid-save.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_EnableArgoStomachFoodPois: Enable Argonian stomachs preventing food poisoning.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_EnableHeatstrokeSwitch: Enable heatstroke resistance for certain races.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_EnableHeatstrokeSwitchToo: This will make certain races gain a different hediff instead of heatstroke, and may even prevent these races from being burnt by intense heat.\n\nThis affects:
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_EnableHypothermiaSwitch: Enable hypothermia resistance for certain races.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_EnableHypothermiaSwitchTo: This will make certain races gain a different hediff instead of hypothermia, and may even prevent these races from being afflicted by frostbite.\n\nThis affects:
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_EnableDecreasedExpecation: Enabled decreased expectations for certain races.
This will cause pawns of specific races to have a lowered expectation level.\n\nThis affects:
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_EnableIncreasedExpecation: Enabled increased expectations for certain races.
This will cause pawns of specific races to have a raised expectation level.\n\nThis affects:
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_DeityNameFix: Enable the deity name Harmony patch.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_DeityNameFix_Tooltip: This will prevent deity names for specific Ideo origins from being randomly selected, avoiding duplicate names within the Ideo.\n\nThis affects:
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_EnableApparelThoughtProte: Enable specific apparel preventing specific weather related thoughts.
While the apparel will prevent the wearer from gaining the thought(s), it will not remove the thought if it is already present.\n\nThis affects:
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_StuffKnowledgeLogging: Enable log messages for stuff knowledge
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_StuffKnowledgeLoggingTool: Enables a few log messages for the stuff knowledge Harmony patch. These will appear in the log during crafting, as well as an additional one on game start, and can help diagnose any issues that may be occuring.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_EnableStuffKnowledge: Enable the stuff knowledge Harmony patch
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_EnableStuffKnowledgeToolt:
If enabled, allows races with stuff knowledge to craft gear that is one quality level higher than normal, assuming any prerequisites are met.

Changing this setting will require a restart to take effect.

This affects:
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_SettlementPreferenceLoggi: Enable log messages for settlement preference

Enables a few log messages for the settlement preference Harmony patch. These will appear during world creation, when factions are settling the world, and can help diagnose any issues that may be occuring.
Enable additional log messages for settlement preference

Enables additional log messages for the settlement preference Harmony patch. These will appear during world creation, when factions are settling the world, and can help diagnose any issues that may be occuring.\n\nThese messages will quickly fill up the log. It is recommended that only a single faction is enabled at a time when using this.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_EnableSettlementPreferenc: Enable the settlement preference Harmony patch

If enabled, factions that have the settlement preference mod extension will be more likely to settle in specific locations.

This can be toggled at any time, but will obviously require a new world to take effect.

This affects:
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_SettlementPreferenceItera: Maximum number of iterations for settlement preference

If settlement preference is unable to find a desirable tile within this number of iterations, it will revert control to RimWorld.\n\nDecreasing this may improve world generation times, while increasing it may allow for more desirable settlement locations.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_BeastMasterLogging: Enable log messages for beast masters
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_BeastMasterLoggingTooltip: Enables a few log messages for the beast master mechanic. These will appear when a beast master pawn appears, and can help diagnose any issues that may be occurring.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_EnableBeastMasterTooltip:
If enabled, allows certain pawn kinds to generate additional pawns when they are created.

This can be toggled at any time.

This affects:
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_IdeologyOverrideTooltip: This can be changed at any time, however the requirement tooltip will remain unchanged until the game is restarted. This doesn't mean it hasn't worked.\n\nThis affects:
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_IdeologyOverrideRace: Override the race requirement for Ideo roles.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_IdeologyOverridePsychSens: Override the minimum psychic sensitivity requirement for Ideo roles.
The required minimum psychic sensitivity for relevant Ideo roles.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_LeatherThoughtMerTooltip: This is a consolidated thought that accounts for all Mer leather.\n\nNote that you will need at least on Mer mod active for this to actually do anything.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_LeatherThoughtGoblinKenTo: This is a consolidated thought that accounts for all Goblin-ken leather.\n\nNote that you will need at least on Goblin-ken mod active for this to actually do anything.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_LeatherThoughtBeastfolkTo: This is a consolidated thought that accounts for all Beastfolk leather.\n\nNote that you will need at least on Beastfolk mod active for this to actually do anything.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_OrsimerAreMer: Orsimer leather is counted as Mer leather, as opposed to Goblin-ken leather.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_DunmerGraveWhispering: Enable filled ash burial pit whispers.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_SeancePsylinkChance: The chance a random pawn gains a psylink from an ancestral seance ritual.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_MaormerLeviathanChance: The chance a Maormer is a leviathan.
LanguageData.ESCP_RaceTools_SloadThrassianPlagueIncid: Sload do not raid the player. Being hostile to a Sload faction will instead enable the Thrassian Plague incident, but only if this setting is enabled.
